page.title: 01D BLOCK:GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The land is mainly farming land,some is for crops like wheat,barley and corn or some fields might just be resting.The rest of the farm land is mainly for grazing-dairy and beef cattle and sheep.The land itself is fairly hilly and there are three rivers,The River Yeo,River Culvery and the River Ted.The woodland is a mixture of coniferous and deciduous trees-the main areas being Meetford and Blackalder Woods.There are also quite a few copses around.There are hardly any houses,a few dotted around. The main hamlets are Venny Tedburn, Uton and Posbury and Fordton.There are very few amenities in our area-only telephone and postboxes (Crediton is the main town that serves this area) There is one railway line-Exeter to Barnstable route.There are only three churches in our block.
